data.title: Tickets On Sale Now

data.text:
Sussex County Miners to Showcase Hometown Heroes and Engage Fans This Summer

Skylands Stadium to Feature Hometown Heroes Night, Grand Slam Beerfest, and More Fun-filled In-game Events

AUGUSTA, NJ – March 30, 2021 – The Sussex County Miners, a professional baseball team that competes in the Frontier League, a partner of Major League Baseball, today announced its lineup of summer events that is set to provide the ultimate fan experience. The Miners will play their home opener at Skylands Stadium on May 27. For the first time ever, the Miners will be featuring a Memorial Day Weekend carnival that begins on May 27 and runs through May 31.

“We are excited for yet another fun season of Miners baseball here at Skylands Stadium,” said Justin Ferrarella, General Manager of the Sussex County Miners. “We can’t wait to feel the atmosphere of the best fans in the world; we missed the energy. It’s time for our best season yet!”

The Miners are excited to feature these noteworthy events throughout the 2021 schedule:

Hometown Heroes Night – Sunday, July 4

Grand Slam Beerfest, including a Miners Manager Bobby Jones Bobblehead – Saturday, July 24

Labor Day Weekend Food Truck Festival Night – Saturday, September 4

9/11 20th Year Anniversary – Saturday, September 11

10 Post-game Firework Shows

8 Giveaways

7 Thirsty Thursdays with $1 Draft Beers and 50-cent Wings

2 Jersey Auctions for Charity (USA and Retro Cardinals Jerseys)

For the full 2021 schedule, as well as individual and season tickets, visit sussexcountyminers.com.

To account for player safety and enhance regional rivalries, the 2021 schedule will be played largely in conference. Additionally, the Miners will adhere to all New Jersey state and league COVID-19 protocols to create a safe environment for fans at all summer events.

About the Sussex County Miners

The Sussex County Miners are New Jersey’s newest professional baseball team. The Miners play a 96- game season from May through September. Their home games are played at Skylands Stadium, one of the premier sports and entertainment venues in North Jersey. The Skylands Stadium Sports Complex is conveniently located in the heart of Sussex County and includes a 4,200-seat stadium, the all-new 17,000-square foot indoor climate controlled Champions Way Sports Academy, 3-acre play and party area, and a spacious parking lot. In addition to baseball, Skylands Stadium also hosts numerous events including food truck festivals, beer festivals, comedy nights, fall festivals, light shows, and holiday extravaganzas, as well as private and corporate functions. For more information or tickets, please click here or call 973-383-7644.

About The Frontier League

Debuting in 1993, the Frontier League is the largest of the Major League Baseball Partner Leagues and features teams stretching from the Atlantic Ocean to the Mississippi River and from the Ohio River to the St. Lawrence Seaway. More information and the complete 2021 schedule can be found at www.frontierleague.com.
